metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7674 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The CORS Filter in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M21, 8.5.0 to 8.5.15,8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.44 and 7.0.41 to 7.0.78 did not add an HTTP Vary headerindicating that the response varies depending on Origin. This permittedclient and server side cache poisoning in some circumstances.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
tomcat8 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.5').
